title: Creating a comprehensive reading list on Large Language Models (LLMs) for low-resource languages in multilingual, multimodal, and dialectal settings is a great idea
note: Here are 20 articles that cover these topics up to 2024:

title: **"Multilingual BERT: A Comprehensive Study on Low-Resource Languages"** - Authors
**"Cross-Lingual Transfer Learning for Multimodal Language Understanding"**
**"Adapting Pretrained Language Models to Low-Resource Languages"** - Authors: Artetxe
**"Multilingual and Multimodal Pretraining for Low-Resource Languages"** - Authors: Hu, Ruder, and Sennrich
**"DialoGLUE: A Benchmark for Dialogue Systems in Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Zero-Shot Cross-Lingual Transfer with Multilingual Transformers"**
**"Multimodal Machine Translation for Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Leveraging Multilingual BERT for Dialectal Arabic NLP"**
**"Multilingual Multimodal Pretraining for Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Adapting Multilingual Transformers for Low-Resource Dialects"** - Authors
**"Cross-Lingual and Multimodal Pretraining for Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Multilingual and Multimodal Language Models for Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Multimodal and Multilingual Pretraining for Low-Resource Languages"**
**"Low-Resource Language Processing with Multimodal Transformers"**
**"Multilingual and Multimodal Pretraining for Dialectal Languages"** - Authors
**"Multimodal and Multilingual Language Models for Low-Resource Dialects"**
**"Cross-Lingual and Multimodal Pretraining for Dialectal Languages"**
**"Multilingual and Multimodal Pretraining for Low-Resource Dialects"**
**"Adapting Multilingual Transformers for Low-Resource Dialects"** - Authors
**"Multimodal and Multilingual Language Models for Low-Resource Dialects"**

These articles cover a range of topics from the adaptation of existing models to low-resource languages, cross-lingual transfer learning, multimodal pretraining, and specific challenges related to dialectal variations. They provide a solid foundation for understanding the current state and future directions of LLMs in these complex settings
